## Voice.on() method

Call invite notification tapped event. Raised when the body of a push notification of a pending call invite has been tapped.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
on(callInviteNotificationTappedEvent: Voice.Event.CallInviteNotificationTapped, listener: Voice.Listener.CallInviteNotificationTapped): this;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  callInviteNotificationTappedEvent | [Voice.Event.CallInviteNotificationTapped](./voice-react-native-sdk.voice_namespace.event_enum.md) |  |
|  listener | [Voice.Listener.CallInviteNotificationTapped](./voice-react-native-sdk.voice_namespace.listener_namespace.callinvitenotificationtapped_typealias.md) |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

this

## Remarks

Unsupported platforms: - iOS

This event is raised by the native layer, i.e. through the native Android UI.

This event is never raised when the application is running on the iOS platform due to CallKit. Attaching a listener while running on an iOS device is a no-operation, the listener will never be invoked, but no error will occur.
